content:
What a great idea! Keeping a list of movies you want to watch can help you stay on top of new releases, explore different genres, and ensure you don't miss out on hidden gems.

Here are some suggestions on how to keep track of your "to-watch" list:

1. **Letterboxd:** A fantastic platform for film enthusiasts! Create an account, and you can add movies to your watchlist, rate and review them, and even follow friends to see what they're watching.
2. **IMDb Watchlist:** If you're already using IMDb, you can create a watchlist and add movies to it. You can also prioritize them, add notes, and mark them as watched.
3. **Spreadsheet or Google Sheets:** Create a spreadsheet with columns for movie title, genre, release year, and any other relevant details. You can also use filters and sorting to organize your list.
4. **Note-taking app:** Use a note-taking app like Evernote, OneNote, or Simplenote to keep a list of movies you want to watch. You can add tags, prioritize them, and even set reminders.
5. **Physical notebook or journal:** If you prefer a more analog approach, dedicate a notebook or journal to your movie watchlist. You can add movie posters, notes, and ratings to make it more engaging.
6. **Movie tracking apps:** Apps like Flickchart, MovieLens, or iCheckMovies allow you to track movies you want to watch, rate them, and even get personalized recommendations.
7. **Pinterest board:** Create a Pinterest board for your movie watchlist, and add pins for each movie. You can add notes, genres, and even create sections for different types of movies.

Choose the method that works best for you, or feel free to experiment with a combination of these options. Happy movie tracking!
